trans-unit.source: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.
trans-unit.target: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks are lightweight classes that the OS runs in the background.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks are lightweight classes that the OS runs in the background.

trans-unit.source: You can use background tasks to provide functionality when your app is suspended or not running.
trans-unit.target: You can use background tasks to provide functionality when your app is suspended or not running.

trans-unit.source: You can also use background tasks for real-time communication apps like VOIP, mail, and IM.
trans-unit.target: You can also use background tasks for real-time communication apps like VOIP, mail, and IM.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks are separate classes that implement the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) interface.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks are separate classes that implement the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) interface.

trans-unit.source: You register a background task by using the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) class.
trans-unit.target: You register a background task by using the [**BackgroundTaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) class.

trans-unit.source: The class name is used to specify the entry point when you registering the background task.
trans-unit.target: The class name is used to specify the entry point when you registering the background task.

trans-unit.source: To get started quickly with a background task, see [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).
trans-unit.target: To get started quickly with a background task, see [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).

trans-unit.source: **Tip** Starting with Windows 10, you no longer need to place an app on the lock screen in order to register background tasks.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** Starting with Windows 10, you no longer need to place an app on the lock screen in order to register background tasks.

trans-unit.target: Background tasks for system events

trans-unit.source: Conditions for background tasks
trans-unit.target: Conditions for background tasks

trans-unit.source: You can control when the background task runs, even after it is triggered, by adding a condition.
trans-unit.target: You can control when the background task runs, even after it is triggered, by adding a condition.

trans-unit.source: Once triggered, a background task will not run until all of its conditions are met.
trans-unit.target: Once triggered, a background task will not run until all of its conditions are met.

trans-unit.source: The following conditions (represented by the [**SystemConditionType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224835) enumeration) can be used.
trans-unit.target: The following conditions (represented by the [**SystemConditionType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224835) enumeration) can be used.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks
trans-unit.target: Background tasks

trans-unit.source: The following real-time triggers can be used to run lightweight custom code in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following real-time triggers can be used to run lightweight custom code in the background:

trans-unit.source: **Control Channel: **Background tasks can keep a connection alive, and receive messages on the control channel, by using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).
trans-unit.target: **Control Channel: **Background tasks can keep a connection alive, and receive messages on the control channel, by using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032).

trans-unit.source: If your app is listening to a socket, you can use the Socket Broker instead of the **ControlChannelTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: If your app is listening to a socket, you can use the Socket Broker instead of the **ControlChannelTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: For more details on using the Socket Broker, see [SocketActivityTrigger](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).
trans-unit.target: For more details on using the Socket Broker, see [SocketActivityTrigger](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn806009).

trans-unit.source: The **ControlChannelTrigger** is not supported on Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: The **ControlChannelTrigger** is not supported on Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: **Timer: **Background tasks can run as frequently as every 15 minutes, and they can be set to run at a certain time by using the [**TimeTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224843).
trans-unit.target: **Timer: **Background tasks can run as frequently as every 15 minutes, and they can be set to run at a certain time by using the [**TimeTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224843).

trans-unit.source: For more info see [Run a background task on a timer](run-a-background-task-on-a-timer-.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info see [Run a background task on a timer](run-a-background-task-on-a-timer-.md).

trans-unit.source: **Push Notification: **Background tasks respond to the [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) to receive raw push notifications.
trans-unit.target: **Push Notification: **Background tasks respond to the [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) to receive raw push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Guidelines for background tasks](guidelines-for-background-tasks.md).

trans-unit.source: Background task resource constraints
trans-unit.target: Background task resource constraints

trans-unit.source: Background tasks are lightweight.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks are lightweight.

trans-unit.source: Keeping background execution to a minimum ensures the best user experience with foreground apps and battery life.
trans-unit.target: Keeping background execution to a minimum ensures the best user experience with foreground apps and battery life.

trans-unit.source: This is enforced by applying resource constraints to background tasks:
trans-unit.target: This is enforced by applying resource constraints to background tasks:

trans-unit.source: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.

trans-unit.source: Additional background task resource constraints
trans-unit.target: Additional background task resource constraints

trans-unit.source: Memory constraints
trans-unit.target: Memory constraints

trans-unit.source: Due to the resource constraints for low-memory devices, background tasks may have a memory limit that determines the maximum amount of memory the background task can use.
trans-unit.target: Due to the resource constraints for low-memory devices, background tasks may have a memory limit that determines the maximum amount of memory the background task can use.

trans-unit.source: If your background task attempts an operation that would exceed this limit, the operation will fail and may generate an out-of-memory exception that the task can handle.
trans-unit.target: If your background task attempts an operation that would exceed this limit, the operation will fail and may generate an out-of-memory exception that the task can handle.

trans-unit.source: If the task does not handle the out-of-memory exception, or the nature of the attempted operation is such that an out-of-memory exception was not generated, then the task will be terminated immediately.
trans-unit.target: If the task does not handle the out-of-memory exception, or the nature of the attempted operation is such that an out-of-memory exception was not generated, then the task will be terminated immediately.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**MemoryManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn633831) APIs to query your current memory usage and limit in order to discover your cap (if any), and to monitor your background task's ongoing memory usage.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**MemoryManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn633831) APIs to query your current memory usage and limit in order to discover your cap (if any), and to monitor your background task's ongoing memory usage.

trans-unit.source: Per-device limit for apps with background tasks for low-memory devices
trans-unit.target: Per-device limit for apps with background tasks for low-memory devices

trans-unit.source: On memory-constrained devices, there is a limit to the number of apps that can be installed on a device and use background tasks at any given time.
trans-unit.target: On memory-constrained devices, there is a limit to the number of apps that can be installed on a device and use background tasks at any given time.

trans-unit.source: If this number is exceeded, the call to [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485), which is required to register all background tasks, will fail.
trans-unit.target: If this number is exceeded, the call to [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485), which is required to register all background tasks, will fail.

trans-unit.source: Battery Saver
trans-unit.target: Battery Saver

trans-unit.source: Unless you exempt your app so that it can still run background tasks and receive push notifications when Battery Saver is on, the Battery Saver feature, when enabled, will prevent background tasks from running when the device is not connected to external power and the battery goes below a specified amount of power remaining.
trans-unit.target: Unless you exempt your app so that it can still run background tasks and receive push notifications when Battery Saver is on, the Battery Saver feature, when enabled, will prevent background tasks from running when the device is not connected to external power and the battery goes below a specified amount of power remaining.

trans-unit.source: This will not prevent you from registering background tasks.
trans-unit.target: This will not prevent you from registering background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Background task resource guarantees for real-time communication
trans-unit.target: Background task resource guarantees for real-time communication

trans-unit.source: To prevent resource quotas from interfering with real-time communication functionality, background tasks using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) and [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) receive guaranteed CPU resource quotas for every running task.
trans-unit.target: To prevent resource quotas from interfering with real-time communication functionality, background tasks using the [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) and [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) receive guaranteed CPU resource quotas for every running task.

trans-unit.source: The resource quotas are as mentioned above, and remain constant for these background tasks.
trans-unit.target: The resource quotas are as mentioned above, and remain constant for these background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Your app doesn't have to do anything differently to get the guaranteed resource quotas for [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) and [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Your app doesn't have to do anything differently to get the guaranteed resource quotas for [**ControlChannelTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701032) and [**PushNotificationTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700543) background tasks.

trans-unit.source: The system always treats these as critical background tasks.
trans-unit.target: The system always treats these as critical background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Maintenance trigger
trans-unit.target: Maintenance trigger

trans-unit.source: Maintenance tasks only run when the device is plugged in to AC power.
trans-unit.target: Maintenance tasks only run when the device is plugged in to AC power.

trans-unit.source: For more info see [Use a maintenance trigger](use-a-maintenance-trigger.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info see [Use a maintenance trigger](use-a-maintenance-trigger.md).

trans-unit.source: Background task for sensors and devices
trans-unit.target: Background task for sensors and devices

trans-unit.source: Your app can access sensors and peripheral devices from a background task with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) class.
trans-unit.target: Your app can access sensors and peripheral devices from a background task with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) class.

trans-unit.source: You can use this trigger for long-running operations such as data synchronization or monitoring.
trans-unit.target: You can use this trigger for long-running operations such as data synchronization or monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Unlike tasks for system events, a **DeviceUseTrigger** task can only be triggered while your app is running in the foreground and no conditions can be set on it.
trans-unit.target: Unlike tasks for system events, a **DeviceUseTrigger** task can only be triggered while your app is running in the foreground and no conditions can be set on it.

trans-unit.source: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337).
trans-unit.target: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337).

trans-unit.source: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the [**DeviceServicingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297315).
trans-unit.target: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the [**DeviceServicingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297315).

trans-unit.source: A *privileged app* is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.
trans-unit.target: A *privileged app* is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.

trans-unit.source: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.
trans-unit.target: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.
